alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 10:42AM MST until December 15 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 2 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches except between 3 and 8 inches above 8500 feet. A light glaze of ice is possible this morning and evening. Snow and ice may mix with rain at times this afternoon. * WHERE...Central Highlands and Upper Rio Grande Valley. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 2 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Traffic speeds will be reduced. Allow extra time to reach your destination. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes. The weight of heavy wet snow may lead to power outages from broken tree limbs and downed power lines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Upper Rio Grande Valley
